Content.Text:
<RED>Llama Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best llama.
Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Sick</RED> llamas are not allowed to enter.

<RED>Gardening Tour</RED>

Day when a Gardening Tour can be held.

<RED>Spring Harmony Day</RED>

A day for giving girls <BLUE>treats</BLUE> to show
that you appreciate them.

A <BLUE>Soy Milk Cookie</BLUE>, <BLUE>Madeleine</BLUE>, 
<BLUE>Pudding</BLUE>, <BLUE>Cream Puff</BLUE>, <BLUE>Chiffon Cake</BLUE>,
<BLUE>Crepe</BLUE>, or <BLUE>Ice Cream Crepe</BLUE> makes a good gift!

<RED>Yak Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best yak.
Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

Remember, <RED>sick</RED> yaks are not allowed
to enter.

<RED>Beekeeping Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best <BLUE>item
collected from a beehive</BLUE>.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Music Festival</RED>

Everyone gathers to listen to wonderful
music, followed by tea.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Spring Crop Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best spring crops.
You can compete in the <BLUE>vegetable
category</BLUE>, <BLUE>fruit category</BLUE>, <BLUE>flower
category</BLUE>, or <BLUE>other category</BLUE>.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Flower Festival</RED>

A day to give gifts of <BLUE>flowers</BLUE> and <BLUE>bouquets</BLUE>
to everyone to show you appreciate them.

<RED>Alpaca Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best alpaca.
Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

Remember, <RED>baby, sick, or pregnant</RED>
alpacas are not allowed to enter.

<RED>Gardening Tour</RED>

Day when a Gardening Tour can be held.

<RED>Critter Festival: Start</RED>

A contest to catch the largest number of
in-season <BLUE>critters</BLUE>. The rules are
explained and the start announced.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Critter Festival: Results</RED>

A contest to catch the largest number of
in-season <BLUE>critters</BLUE>. The results are
announced and prizes awarded.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Cooking Festival</RED>

A contest to see whose <BLUE>cooking</BLUE>
is the best!

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

The category changes from year to year.

<RED>Fireworks Festival</RED>

Everyone gathers to watch the fireworks.

Starts at <BLUE>8:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Summer Crop Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best summer crops.
You can compete in the <BLUE>vegetable
category</BLUE>, <BLUE>fruit category</BLUE>, <BLUE>flower
category</BLUE>, or <BLUE>other category</BLUE>.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Cow Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best cow.
Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

Remember, <RED>baby, sick or pregnant</RED>
cows are not allowed to take part.

<RED>Gardening Tour</RED>

Day when a Gardening Tour can be held.

<RED>Fishing Festival: Start</RED>

A contest to catch the largest number of
in-season <BLUE>fish</BLUE>. The rules are
explained and the start announced.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Fishing Festival: Results</RED>

A contest to catch the largest number of
in-season <BLUE>fish</BLUE>. The results are
announced and prizes awarded.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Chicken Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best fowl.
Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

Remember, <RED>chicks</RED> and <RED>sick</RED> fowl
are not allowed to take part.

<RED>Foliage Festival</RED>

Everyone goes to appreciate the colorful
changing leaves on the trees and watch
them fall, then eat grilled yams.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Fall Crop Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best fall crops.
You can compete in the <BLUE>vegetable
category</BLUE>, <BLUE>fruit category</BLUE>, <BLUE>flower
category</BLUE>, or <BLUE>other category</BLUE>.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Pumpkin Festival</RED>

A day to give children treats!
Make treats to hand out to the kids!

<RED>Snow Festival</RED>

Everyone makes snow sculptures and then
feasts on hearty stew!

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Gardening Tour</RED>

Day when a Gardening Tour can be held.

<RED>Winter Harmony Day</RED>

A day for giving boys <BLUE>chocolate treats</BLUE>
to show that you appreciate them.

<BLUE>Soft Chocolates</BLUE>, <BLUE>Chocolate Fondue</BLUE>,
<BLUE>Chocolate Cake</BLUE>, <BLUE>Chocolate Cookies</BLUE>,
<BLUE>Chocolate Pudding</BLUE>, <BLUE>Cocoa Pack</BLUE>, or
<BLUE>Chocolate Ice Cream</BLUE> makes a good gift!

<RED>Sheep Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best sheep.
Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> at the 
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

Remember, <RED>baby, sick or pregnant</RED>
sheep are not allowed to take part.

<RED>Starry Night Festival</RED>

A chance to take someone of the opposite sex
on a date to go stargazing!

<RED>Winter Crop Festival</RED>

A contest to pick the best winter crops.
You can compete in the <BLUE>vegetable
category</BLUE>, <BLUE>fruit category</BLUE>, <BLUE>flower
category</BLUE>, or <BLUE>other category</BLUE>.

Starts at <BLUE>12:00</BLUE> PM at the
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>New Year's Eve</RED>

Everyone eats soba noodles and then
parties until midnight!

Starts at <BLUE>9:00</BLUE> PM at the
<GREEN>Festival Grounds</GREEN>.

<RED>Wedding anniversary</RED>

The day of your wedding.
Celebrate it with your family!
